timeline.message:
Fix testNestedWrites testcase in JanusGraphIndexTest

The test case builds a mixed index using TEXT mapping, but uses
equality condition in query (which does not use this mixed
index). This makes one assertion does not work as expected, and
as a consequence, passes the test by chance. This commit fixes the
mixed index usage and the assertion to uncover the real problem.

Related to #2176

Signed-off-by: Boxuan Li <liboxuan@connect.hku.hk>

timeline.bodyText:
What if there are valid non-ghost vertices within the Iterable that just have no neighbors?
I think they are considered "removed" here, right? Should they?
timeline.author: rngcntr

replies.bodyText: I guess you are misguided by the method name, "edgeQuery". It does not check neighbors, the method name is "edgeQuery" because almost everything is an edge in JanusGraph to my understanding. The method queries "edgeStore", which stores all vertices, properties, and edges.
replies.author: li-boxuan

replies.bodyText: Thanks for pointing that out! You are completely right, I misunderstood edgeQuery.
replies.author: rngcntr

timeline.bodyText: What's the logical difference between this line and the original one?
timeline.author: rngcntr

replies.author: li-boxuan
